SAFETY CLOUD
Set Up Events with Occasions

Safety Cloud comes with an Occasion Object data model that allows you to create Health Verification configurations specific to an event.

REQUIRED EDITIONS
Available in: Enterprise and Unlimited editions

Workers are heading back to offices and businesses are holding in-person events again. However; viruses and variants are still around, new treatments and tests are being developed, and guidelines and recommendations change constantly and can vary by region.

To ensure the safety of workers and event attendees, you need a health verification process that is flexible, reliable, and verifiable.

With Safety Cloud Health Verification, you can:

Create Health Verification forms that are relevant and specific to an Occasion and which present and collect the required criteria for participating in or attending the occasion.
Set a window of time for access and QR code generation based on a comparative date-time analysis of the occasion date and a laboratory test date.
Customize labels and add company logos or other images to your Health Verification form.
Set up and define Occasion-specific email communications for employees and event attendees.
Occasions and the Occasion Object

In Safety Cloud, events such as a company kickoff or remote employees returning to the workplace, are referred to as Occasions. Because health requirements can vary by Occasion, you need the flexibility to create occasion-specific health verifications. With the Safety Cloud Occasion Object data model, you can run and manage Health Verifications for each Occasion simultaneously from a single org.

In Safety Cloud, Health Verification configurations consist of an Occasion object and its child objects.

The child objects include the configuration settings that control various aspects of Health Verification for the Occasion. Aspects such as the layout of the Health Verification form, criteria for generating QR codes to access an event, and email communications with event attendees.

To create Health Verification for an Occasion, you must configure the Occasion Object and its associated child objects, as explained in these Salesforce Help articles.

Create an Occasion
Use the Occasion Object that comes with Safety Cloud to create Health Verification configurations specific to an event.
Create an Occasion Setting
Use Occasion Settings to specify the details of the Health Verification form and the Health Verification records that Safety Cloud creates when a user submits the form.
Create Occasion Access Settings
Use Occasion Access Settings to specify the date range for which the QR code is valid. Also use it to specify the type of test or vaccination combinations required for generating a QR code URL and adding it to the Health Verification record.
Set up a Digital Experience Site with the Health Verification Form
The Safety Cloud Template package includes an LWC component that contains the Health Verification form. If you installed the Template Package, you must set up the Digital Experience to host the LWC component on an unauthenticated site so your users can access it.
